sn35.26:4.1: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding the all, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:4.2: And what is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering?
sn35.26:4.3: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the eye, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:4.4: Without directly knowing and completely understanding sights …
sn35.26:4.7: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:4.8: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the ear … the nose … the tongue …
sn35.26:4.14: the mind, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:4.15: Without directly knowing and completely understanding phenomena …
sn35.26:4.18: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:4.19: This is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:5.1: By directly knowing and completely understanding the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:5.2: And what is the all, directly knowing and completely understanding which, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering?
sn35.26:5.3: By directly knowing and completely understanding the eye …
sn35.26:5.8: the ear … the nose … the tongue …
sn35.26:5.14: the mind, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:5.15: By directly knowing and completely understanding phenomena …
sn35.26:5.18: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:5.19: This is the all, directly knowing and completely understanding which, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”
